summary: Francis Pugeda, Director for AI Delivery at Globe Telecom, the largest mobile telecommunication company in the Philippines, shares insights on adopting Google Workspace with Gemini. He emphasizes technology, process, and people as core considerations, noting that 87% of employees save 3-4 hours weekly by using Gemini in Gmail for email polishing and in Google Docs for AI chatbot creation.

title: How Globe Telecom rings in productivity gains with Google Workspace with Gemini
author: Google Workspace
description:
Featured in this video: Francis Pugeda, Director for AI Delivery, Globe Telecom

Executive summary: In 2013, Globe Telecom, the largest mobile telecommunication company in the Philippines, embraced Google Workspace to solve challenges with outdated collaboration tools, significantly boosting employee satisfaction. Now, Globe Telecom has integrated Gemini into its workflows. Through extensive training, the company has seen 80% adoption, with 87% of users gaining 3-4 hours of productivity per week, empowering staff to maximize AI in their daily tasks.

Challenge: Prior to 2013, Globe Telecom struggled with traditional workplace bottlenecks: full inboxes, version control issues with email attachments, and high costs due to frequent tool replacements. As the largest telecom in the Philippines, the company needed a modern, secure, and cost-effective solution that would simplify communication and collaboration. Then, when generative AI emerged, Globe Telecom wanted to strategically integrate the technology across the tools and processes that power its business.

Solution: Globe Telecom became the first company to adopt Google Workspace in the Philippines in 2013. This platform offered seamless, browser-based collaboration, co-editing, universal document access, and robust single sign-on security. Building on this foundation, Globe Telecom strategically introduced Gemini, focusing on empowering people and processes with the latest technology. The team identified early adopters, conducted extensive training on using Gemini across Workspace applications, and created a Google Chat space for users to share experiences.

Result: The initial adoption of Google Workspace significantly improved employee satisfaction, with their promoter score rising from 73 in 2011 to 90 in 2016. With the introduction of Gemini, adoption rose to 80% among employees. They primarily use Gemini in Gmail to polish emails, in Google Docs for inspiration, and in the Gemini app. A notable discovery was the ability to create AI chatbots using NotebookLM by feeding it documents. Following the rollout of Gemini, 87% of users agreed they are more productive, saving an average of three to four hours per week. This empowers employees to discover and maximize AI capabilities within their workflows.

title: How VaynerX went from Google Workspace power users to AI-driven leaders with Gemini
author: Google Workspace
description:
Featured in this video: Ben Allison, EVP of Media at VaynerMedia & Melissa Moriarty, Deputy General Counsel and EVP of Innovation and Policy at VaynerX

Executive summary: VaynerX, embraced Google Workspace from day one for asynchronous collaboration across teams and time zones. When evaluating AI technologies, the team chose Gemini for its enterprise-grade security and privacy protections that meet its clients‚Äô requirements. The integration of Gemini across the Workspace solutions that teams already know saves time on mundane tasks while enabling them to focus on strategic work like creating new policies and shortening creative production timelines.

Challenge: As emerging AI technologies gained popularity, VaynerX clients ‚Äî particularly Fortune 500 companies ‚Äî needed guidance on AI adoption but had strict requirements that their data could not be used to train any models. The agency needed sophisticated enterprise AI partners who could understand both VaynerX's needs and its clients' security and privacy requirements while working in an asynchronous, multi-timezone environment.

Solution: VaynerX chose Google Workspace with Gemini because the company already used the full Workspace suite to power collaboration and productivity. The platform also offered industry-leading protections with superior security and privacy controls. The team integrated Gemini across workflows to support the full marketing lifecycle, from insights and strategy to activation 

Result: The implementation of Google Workspace with Gemini delivered immediate practical value and strategic advantages. Legal teams save significant time with automated meeting notes and summaries in Google Meet, while creative and media teams use AI to shorten production timelines and reduce costs for clients. Gemini handles mundane tasks, freeing up teams to focus on high-value work like creating new policies and procedures that help business partners create better content. It also enables faster transition from insights and strategy to smart activation plans, and supports more effective post-campaign analysis to optimize for the future.

title: How VaynerX securely helps clients unlock their potential using Google Workspace with Gemini
author: Google Workspace
description:
Featured in this video: Avery Akkineni, Chief Marketing Officer, VaynerX

Executive summary: By adopting Google Workspace with Gemini, VaynerX is able to innovate and maintain its tight security standards. With a central collaboration solution its international offices are empowered to work together asynchronously, and deliver a consistent, global client experience. The company can also pioneer new client strategies and deliver more quickly with Gemini built into its everyday workflows. With features like ""Take Notes for Me"" and image generation capabilities combined with Workspace‚Äôs enterprise-grade security controls, VaynerX ensures consistent client deliverables and meets ambitious goals while minimizing risk.

Challenge: VaynerX supports a wide range of clients by helping them unlock their potential through creative and media. Working with this diverse portfolio also means accessing and managing a large volume of client assets, and the company has to ensure that client data is secure even as it implements new technologies like generative AI. Internally, the company needs to stay aligned across its international offices to deliver the best possible work to clients efficiently and at scale.

Solution: By adopting Google Workspace with Gemini the company is able to keep aligned while meeting both its innovation and security goals. The global team works across the Workspace suite to collaborate on Google Meet, Slides, Sheets, and more from Mexico City to Miami to Delhi. More recently, with Gemini embedded throughout VaynerX‚Äôs Workspace products, the team has developed custom gems that can be trained on publicly available information to better understand and meet client needs. 

Result: By centralizing the team‚Äôs collaborative and creative efforts, VaynerX is able to deliver a truly global experience. Now, with generative AI built into their everyday workflows, VaynerX can pioneer new strategies for clients. With Take Notes for Me, every team from production to creative, media, and strategy all have a secure, accurate notetaker to ensure consistency across client deliverables. Plus, since Gemini shares permission and access controls with the full Workspace suite, the team can continue to meet its ambitious goals without sacrificing privacy and security. 

Highlights and key takeaways from our interview with Avery Akkineni, Chief Marketing Officer, VaynerX:
